item.title: The SanScript Library could not be loaded, and Integration Manager is affected.
item.description: Towards the end of the previous month, a client reached out for help with their Dynamics GP year-end update. After resolving that, they described a separate Integration Manager problem that a previous consultant couldn’t fix, even after resorting to completely reinstalling the system. Intrigued, I decided to investigate further. The client demonstrated that when running an integration on a specific machine, it would initially start but then fail with the error message “Unable to load SanScript Library.

item.title: The creation wizard for the forecaster database has failed. We apologize for the inconvenience.
item.description: Setting up a new database in Forecaster is usually simple. You just open the Forecaster Database Creation Wizard, connect to your SQL Server, input the database details, and you’re done. However, recently I encountered a problem where the wizard unexpectedly stopped working after I named the new database. This happened on multiple computers, but interestingly, creating the database on a different SQL Server worked fine. After checking the Application Event Log, I found a vague .

item.title: Access Denied Party due to Unhandled Object Exception!
item.description: Today, I came across a strange problem. A client could log into GP but got “Unhandled Object Exception” and “Access Denied” errors when clicking on home pages or area pages. The “Unhandled Object Exceptions,” besides saying “Access Denied,” also mentioned “Error Calling Method Save,” pointing towards a permissions issue. Some sources linked similar home page errors to missing files like “AreaPage.xsl,” “HomePage.css,” “HomePage.xsl,” and “PreviewPane.xsl” in the Backgrounds folder. We checked, and the files were present.

item.title: The object name 'DYNAMICS..taErrorCode' is not valid.
item.description: Was it a full moon or were there sunspots causing strange occurrences? Just tonight, while setting up a new eConnect integration on a client’s development server, I encountered a strange problem. Upon running the integration, I was greeted with an SQL Exception error stating: “Invalid object name ‘DYNAMICS..taErrorCode’”. This was perplexing, as I have extensive experience with eConnect integrations and had never encountered this error before. My usual resources, Google and PartnerSource, provided no helpful solutions.
